page.title: 20PROBLEMS OF TYDD ST.GILES
page.content: Villagers worry about employment for young people.Nowadays farmers employ fewer workers, and there are practically no other opportunities in the village.A small wrought-iron works has started,but employs only one young man. Recently,the last village pub has closed,general feeling being that the brewery deliberately allowed it to run down,so that they could sell it for housing.Protests have succeeded in delaying the sale while the matter is reconsidered.Loss of the village pub leaves a large hole in village life. The possibility that the village school may close is another worry.The roll has fallen to 4 3,and there has been talk of merging with the schoool in the neighbouring village. Contributors - the schoolchildren of Tydd St.Giles.
